paragraphs.text: The Evacuee Crisis refers to the displacement of civilians in Republic City following the events of the Invasion of the United Republic of Nations. Many civilians lost their homes and were forced to live in camps in Republic City. Zhu Li Moon and the Air Nation worked to help provide housing and food to the civilians in the city, for which they received support and funding from President Raiko.

paragraphs.text: After the Earth Kingdom collapsed in 171 AG, Kuvira begun attempting to unite the kingdom once more under the flag of the Earth Empire. After conquering most of the Earth Kingdom once more, she invaded Republic City with her fully military, as well as a large mecha suit equipped with a spirit energy cannon. Prince Wu and Pema led the evacuation effort, allowing most of the city's civilians to escape the fighting in the city. Throughout the course of the battle, Kuvira's mecha suit and other military units caused a massive amount of property damage. The fighting was only ended by the spirit energy canon breaking, resulting in a large explosion and the creation of the Republic City spirit portal.

paragraphs.body: In the weeks following the end of the invasion, a temporary evacuee camp was created on a grassy field nearby Republic City. The space was lined with yellow tents for the evacuees to stay in; food was shipped from ${link_0} regularly to be prepared for the evacuees in need. Zhu Li was in charge of receiving these deliveries and gathering volunteers to help cook and distribute the food, many volunteers being members of the Air Nation or Varrick. In addition to food volunteers, ${link_1} and other waterbenders were volunteer healers for any civilians who had been injured in the events of the invasion.
paragraphs.text: In the weeks following the end of the invasion, a temporary evacuee camp was created on a grassy field nearby Republic City. The space was lined with yellow tents for the evacuees to stay in; food was shipped from Ba Sing Se regularly to be prepared for the evacuees in need. Zhu Li was in charge of receiving these deliveries and gathering volunteers to help cook and distribute the food, many volunteers being members of the Air Nation or Varrick. In addition to food volunteers, Kya and other waterbenders were volunteer healers for any civilians who had been injured in the events of the invasion.

paragraphs.text: Zhu Li Moon leads volunteers assisting at the evacuee camp.

paragraphs.body: Upon ${link_0}'s return from her vacation with ${link_1}, she and the business woman visited the evacuee camp to help volunteer. As she arrived, Tenzin and other members of the Air Nation greeted the two. Tenzin told Korra that Zhu Li had taken leadership of the camp during the crisis and that Raiko had been of no help, having not even visited the camp. Asami asked what she and Korra could do to help, and Kya said it might be helpful if Korra visited the evacuees, and Asami elected to stay behind and help Zhu Li do some practical work.
paragraphs.text: Upon Korra's return from her vacation with Asami Sato, she and the business woman visited the evacuee camp to help volunteer. As she arrived, Tenzin and other members of the Air Nation greeted the two. Tenzin told Korra that Zhu Li had taken leadership of the camp during the crisis and that Raiko had been of no help, having not even visited the camp. Asami asked what she and Korra could do to help, and Kya said it might be helpful if Korra visited the evacuees, and Asami elected to stay behind and help Zhu Li do some practical work.

paragraphs.body: Korra walked around the camp, as many evacuees ran up to greet her. Korra apologized for their circumstances and asked the evacuees if there was anything she could do to help them. While many people quickly overwhelmed her with requests for help with tasks like heating tea, or finding lost dogs. Korra created a pillar, giving a speech to the evacuees and promising that she would work her hardest to make sure the evacuees would get permanent housing.

paragraphs.body: Korra, Asami, and Zhu Li met with Raiko to request funding for a project to build housing for evacuees. Raiko was initially reluctant, as he was already spending extra money having to move the government and hire new police officers. However, Asami and Zhu Li reminded him that ${link_0} and ${link_1} could contribute money toward the cause, and Raiko's campaign manager suggested it may be a good way to court favor with voters; thus, Raiko agreed to fund the project.
paragraphs.text: Korra, Asami, and Zhu Li met with Raiko to request funding for a project to build housing for evacuees. Raiko was initially reluctant, as he was already spending extra money having to move the government and hire new police officers. However, Asami and Zhu Li reminded him that Future Industries and Varrick Global Industries could contribute money toward the cause, and Raiko's campaign manager suggested it may be a good way to court favor with voters; thus, Raiko agreed to fund the project.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} and ${link_1} expressed their concerns over ${link_2}'s presentation to the evacuees and press.
paragraphs.text: Zhu Li Moon and Asami Sato expressed their concerns over Raiko's presentation to the evacuees and press.

paragraphs.body: Construction on the housing project began shortly after the meeting with Raiko, and when discussing the matter with Zhu Li, Asami estimated construction could be complete within a few months. As the two discussed, Raiko began speaking to some concerned evacuees about the project. He estimated they could be able to move into the new housing in only a month and promptly dubbed the project "Raiko Residencies". Zhu Li and Asami Sato moved to voice concerns with him, Zhu Li telling him he should not make promises he would be unable keep and Asami protesting the name of the project, as she and Zhu Li had pitched the project to Raiko, rather than the other way around. Raiko suggested to the evacuees that Korra had been responsible for the destruction that had lost them their homes, causing Asami Sato to angrily call him a coward, and she insisted it was his fault for retreating when Kuvira attacked the city. Heading back to her office, Asami suggested that Tenzin run against Raiko. Tenzin instead said that he thought Zhu Li would make a better candidate, due to the leadership she had showed with the evacuees.

paragraphs.body:
,
The following evening, Zhu Li, Varrick, Tenzin and Kya stood at the food tents as a line of evacuees angrily questioned where the food they had been missing all day was. Zhu Li responded that she believed it would be there soon, as Raiko had promised the food from Ba Sing Se would move through customs rapidly. Zhu Li remarked that earlier Raiko had appeared to have the evacuees interest at heart, but it was clearly only to suit his own needs. As she took a break from controlling the line, she questioned if perhaps she should run for President, an idea to which Varrick agreed and offered to pledge his support.

The following evening, Zhu Li, Varrick, Tenzin and Kya stood at the food tents as a line of evacuees angrily questioned where the food they had been missing all day was. Zhu Li responded that she believed it would be there soon, as Raiko had promised the food from Ba Sing Se would move through customs rapidly. Zhu Li remarked that earlier Raiko had appeared to have the evacuees interest at heart, but it was clearly only to suit his own needs. As she took a break from controlling the line, she questioned if perhaps she should run for President, an idea to which Varrick agreed and offered to pledge his support.

paragraphs.body: In the coming days, Zhu Li publicly announced her run for president in the Republic City newspapers. She was more popular among voters due to her presence among the evacuees and lack of Raiko's poor reputation after his surrender. In an attempt to appeal to voters, Raiko cracked down on the Air Nation protests of his occupation at the portals, while Zhu Li, many of her supporters, and a film crew began to join the Air Nation in their protest. As Tokuga attacked the portal, Zhu Li's efforts in ensuring safety for Republic City's civilians gave her favor over Raiko, who had fled during the assault, and ultimately led to her election as the second president of the United Republic of Nations.
